knimeNode.name: Column Header Extractor
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates new table with a single row or column containing the column names of the input table.

fullDescription.intro: Creates new table with a single row or column containing the column names. The node has two outports: The first port contains the column headers (all columns are of type string), either as a single row containing all headers or as one row per header. The second outport contains the input data, whereby the column names are changed to a default pattern (given that the corresponding option is set.)
fullDescription.option: If selected replaces the column names with new generated names. The names are generated by combining the prefix (provided below) with the column number. Otherwise the original column names will be used in the output tables.
Prefix of the new column names

The format in which the top output table provides the column names:
Row: The column names are output as a single row with a column per name.
Column: The column names are output as a single column with a row per name.

Select the type of the columns to extract the names from:
All: All columns are processed.
String: Only string-compatible columns are processed, this includes e.g. XML columns.
Integer: Only integer-compatible columns are processed.
Double: Only double-compatible columns are processed. This includes integer and long columns.

ports.outPort: Table with single row or column containing original column names

outPort.name: Input table with replaced column header

ports.outPort: Input table with either original or changed column names
